page.title: 16Cilcain Primary School
page.content: Three buildings have been used as the village school in Cilcain. The first, now a private dwelling, was built in 1799. A larger school was built about 1842, remaining in use until replaced by the present school in 1962. It is now used as the village hall. Pupil-numbers at the school, called 'Ysgol y Foel', have risen in recent years: there are now 88 children aged 4_11 at the school, while 3-year-olds normally attend a nursery-class each afternoon. There are three full-time and one part-time teaching staff, and parents regularly help both in school and with out-of-school activities. As well as standard school-work, special topics have recently included starting a school-garden and the monitoring of nest-boxes erected in the grounds, and groups of older pupils have made trips to stay at two outdoor centres.
